definition: types of facial makeup in operas

sentences.english: Who would “Facebook China” censor and who not?
sentences.chinese: 誰來審查臉譜網中國，誰不會？

sentences.english: Then again, Facebook is a real-name business, not a place for dissidents to go into hiding.
sentences.chinese: 而且臉譜網是實名業務，讓異見者無處藏身。

sentences.english: Today, in the form of blogging software or services like Facebook, it is free.
sentences.chinese: 但是現在，無論是博客還是臉譜網都是免費的。

sentences.english: C. 1051 et seq. ) because it infringes and dilutes the famous Facebook trademark.
sentences.chinese: 因爲它侵犯和稀釋了著名的臉譜，商標。

sentences.english: But Kuo said the new service is not related to Facebook.
sentences.chinese: 但郭怡廣說新的服務與臉譜公司沒有任何關係。

sentences.english: Mr. Schrage came to Facebook in 2008 from Google.
sentences.chinese: 施拉格於2008年從谷歌轉投“臉譜”。

sentences.english: I don't think it's necessarily a bad thing that people with low self-esteem use Facebook.
sentences.chinese: 我倒覺得自卑的人使用臉譜網不一定是件壞事兒。

sentences.english: Click here to view Wooden Painted Face Technics Flow .
sentences.chinese: 點擊此處查看馬勺臉譜工藝流程。

sentences.english: CAO Cao in Peking Opera has a face painted white, which symbolizes "treachery".
sentences.chinese: 在京劇表演中，曹操的臉譜通常是象徵着狡詐的白臉。

sentences.english: He has gotten his users to accept a certain loss of privacy in exchange for free use of Facebook.
sentences.chinese: 他讓臉譜網免費用戶在轉變時接受了一定的個人損失。

sentences.english: Facial makeups are an important part of Peking opera.
sentences.chinese: 臉譜是京劇的一個重要組成部分。

sentences.english: They are investing a total of five hundred million dollars in the company.
sentences.chinese: 兩家公司共同向臉譜網投資了5億美元。

sentences.english: The new services will help Facebook amass even more data on its users’ tastes.
sentences.chinese: 新的服務有助於臉譜積累更多的用戶偏好的數據。

sentences.english: FACEBOOK can be fun place to meet and greet old friends.
sentences.chinese: “臉譜”網站是一個和老朋友碰面打招呼的好地方。

sentences.english: It would be foolish to think Facebook won’t succumb one day, too.
sentences.chinese: 如果認爲臉譜網某一天不會同樣屈服是愚蠢的。
我在臉譜上加你爲好友。

definition: by fair means or foul/by hook or by crook/unscrupulously
to make a show of being original or unconventional (idiom)
to boost support or interest/to campaign/to promote
to take an alternate route (idiom)/to find an alternative/to take a different approach/to blaze a new trail
